private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with vowels: A E I.
I can only remove or place blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
agent_vowel.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that the final single tower from bottom to top is M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with consonants: B C D F G H J K L M.
I can only remove or place blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
agent_consonant.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that the final single tower from bottom to top is M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver.
I will receive planned move sequences or observations from each agent and must integrate them into a single consistent planning problem.
orchestrator.goal: Generate a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the target tower M L K J I H G F E D C B A starting from the given initial configuration while keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: There are 13 uniquely labeled blocks: K B A C I H G E L M J F D.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table. Only top blocks of any stack can be moved and only one block can be moved at a time.
Agent agent_vowel may only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks A E I. Agent agent_consonant may only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks B C D F G H J K L M.
Initial stacks from bottom to top: Stack1 bottom K then I then G then E then L then M then F. Stack2 bottom B then A then C then H then J then D.
The goal is a single tower with M on the table and then L on M then K on L then J on K then I on J then H on I then G on H then F on G then E on F then D on E then C on D then B on C then A on B.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_vowel. Inspect the public information and your private information and produce a clear, ordered sequence of allowed moves that you can perform given your constraints. Represent each move as a tuple (move agent_vowel block from_location to_location). Do not emit PDDL. Focus on moves involving only blocks A, E, and I and only when those blocks are at the top of a stack.
plan.prompt: You are agent_vowel. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private knowledge: {agents->agent_vowel->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->agent_vowel->goal}. Provide a stepwise plan of moves you can perform, each move formatted as (move agent_vowel BLOCK FROM TO). If you lack information about a particular placement, describe what observation you would request rather than making assumptions.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_consonant. Inspect the public information and your private information and produce a clear, ordered sequence of allowed moves that you can perform given your constraints. Represent each move as a tuple (move agent_consonant block from_location to_location). Do not emit PDDL. Focus on moves involving only consonant-labeled blocks and only when those blocks are at the top of a stack.
plan.prompt: You are agent_consonant. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private knowledge: {agents->agent_consonant->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->agent_consonant->goal}. Provide a stepwise plan of moves you can perform, each move formatted as (move agent_consonant BLOCK FROM TO). If you lack information about a particular placement, describe what observation you would request rather than making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent Blocksworld PDDL and must produce a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem. Integrate the move sequences provided by the two agents and resolve any naming or referencing differences. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain should be STRIPS-compatible and suitable for FastDownward. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or encoding agent identity in action names (for example move-vowel and move-consonant). Include predicates that encode on, ontable, clear, and handempty as needed. Ensure the final problem encodes the initial state from the public information and the final goal tower M L K J I H G F E D C B A.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the following inputs: the vowel agent plan {vowel_plan} and the consonant agent plan {consonant_plan}. Your task is to produce a single PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward planner that models two agents with distinct action schemas and that achieves the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. If the agents provided partial or ambiguous move sequences, integrate them conservatively and ensure the PDDL accurately represents the initial state and the goal. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
